author: automotivetestingtechnologyinternational.com
title: Latest News : Automotive Testing Technology International
text:
SHOW NEWS: Air velocity and temperature measurement
Two exciting new products, a multipoint sensing and data acquisition system and an air velocity and temperature measurement single wire interface tool, were launched by Degree Control at Automotive Testing Expo North America.
The C Port3600 is an innovative network-ready, 36-point channel measurement hub, designed for housing air velocity, humidity or air surface temperature sensors. It has built-in atmospheric humidity and pressure compensation for maximum repeatability.
Meanwhile, the airflow C Grid is an interface tool designed for measuring airflow across a planar area, with simultaneous polling of multiple sensors. It provides up to 200 air velocity and temperature sensors per unit for HVAC evaluation. “Technicians would place this in the passenger or driver seat to run measurements on the vents. It represents what a human would actually feel like when sitting in that position,” explained Jim Bishop, sales executive, embedded products. The C Grid frame can be built to customer specification and it includes data acquisition software for logging real-time velocity and temperature of air flow.
